name: Object Oriented Programming
references: Java: The Complete Reference, Herbert Schildt, 11th edition, Mc Graw Hill, 2019.
Head First Java, Kathy Sierra & Bert Bates, 3rd edition, O’Reilly, 2005.
Clean Code, Robert C Martin, Pearson, 2012.
Timothy Budd, Object Oriented Programming with Java, Pearson Education, 2009.

Object Oriented Programming with Java, Debasis Samanta, IIT Kharagpur, accessed through: [https://cse.iitkgp.ac.in/~dsamanta/java/index.htm](https://cse.iitkgp.ac.in/~dsamanta/java/index.htm), Accessed on: August
Design Patterns, Erich Gamma, Richard Helm, Ralph Johnson and John Vlissides, Addison-Wesley, 1994.
experiments: Develop programs to familiarize with Object Oriented Design concepts.
Implement programs to illustrate overloading and overriding.
Implement programs to familiarize with the Testing and Debugging facilities.
Implement programs using Static classes, blocks and methods.
Implement programs to compare shallow and deep copy.
Develop programs using multi-threading and synchronization.
Implement programs using Linked data structures, Heaps, priority queues, binary search trees and the interfaces List, Set and Map.
Implement programs using String processing facilities offered by String, String Buffer and StringBuilder classes.
Develop Event-driven programs for GUI applications that are interactive, responding to events originating from keyboard and mouse.
Implement programs using Streams and File I/O for reading and writing the contents in sequential and random order.
Given two words of equal length that are in a dictionary, implement an efficient program to transform one word into another word by changing only one letter at a time.
Numbers are randomly generated and passed to a method, implement an efficient program to find and maintain the median value as new values are generated.
Given an N x N matrix of positive and negative integers, implement an efficient program to find the sub-matrix with the largest possible sum.

Overview of Object-Oriented Programming: Understanding final and static: classes, blocks and methods
Exception Handling: try, catch, throw, throws and finally
Multithreaded Programming: Introduction to multitasking through processes and threads
The Collections framework: List, Set and Map interfaces and the corresponding implementation classes
